content.question: In the reaction between <math alttext="C 5 H 5 N aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>N</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H C l aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> represented above, <math alttext="C 5 H 5 N" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> acts as

choices.label: the conjugate base of <math alttext="H C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

the conjugate acid of <math alttext="C 5 H 5 N H with a positive one charge" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>NH]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math>

skill.text: 1.B: Describe the components of and quantitative information from models and representations that illustrate both particulate-level and macroscopic- level properties.
